lessons.name: JavaScript Environment Setup
lessons.description: Believe it or not, JavaScript plays an important role in the world of blockchain. This video will walk you through the necessary JavaScript setup to get started, and if you're hungry for more JavaScript content, be sure to check out FrontendExpert.

lessons.name: JavaScript Crash Course
lessons.description: New to JavaScript? This video will give you all the basics you need. Hungry for more? Have we mentioned FrontendExpert?

lessons.name: Asynchronous Programming With JavaScript
lessons.description: Okay, okay, we promise we'll stop shilling FrontendExpert on these JavaScript lessons. Okay...maybe one last time!

keyTerms.name: Promise
keyTerms.definition: In JavaScript, a Promise is a proxy for a value that is not yet known. Promises can be resolved or rejected. If a promise resolves it usually returns a value. If a promise is rejected it usually means an error occurred. Promises can be handled using the .then(), .catch() and .finally() methods or can be awaited using the await keyword.

keyTerms.name: Async/Await
keyTerms.definition: In JavaScript, the async and await keywords are used for asynchronous programming.The async keyword is used to define that a function will return a Promise. await will pause code execution until a Promise is resolved or rejected.

lessons.name: Introduction To Ethers.js
lessons.description: While this JavaScript library doesn't win any awards for creativity in the naming department, it more than makes up for it in the functionality that it provides.

keyTerms.name: Provider
keyTerms.definition: A blockchain provider is any company/service that provides nodes that can be used to interact with the blockchain.

lessons.name: Querying The Blockchain
